thread.title: Tom Brady, New England Patriots will defeat Indianapolis Colts in Deflategate ... - cleveland.com
thread.title_full: Tom Brady, New England Patriots will defeat Indianapolis Colts in Deflategate ... - cleveland.com

title: Tom Brady, New England Patriots will defeat Indianapolis Colts in Deflategate ... - cleveland.com
text:
Week 5: 6-7-1 
Week 5 summary: I am not ready to throw darts at the wall. Yet. 
Three games from Week 5 pushed me that much closer to desperation. They underscored the difficulty of picking NFL games against the spread. And not just "best bets'' -- all games. 
I absolutely should have gone 9-5. Instead, I finished below .500. Yes, I am bitter. 
Here are the three that sting: 
• @ Kansas City -9 1/2 over Chicago. Chiefs led, 17-3, and had first-and-goal at the 9 early in the third quarter. On first down, running back Jamaal Charles injured his knee on a basic cut. On fourth down, the Bears blocked the field-goal attempt. Chiefs not only failed to cover, they lost, 18-17. 
• Seattle +3 over @ Cincinnati. Seahawks led, 24-7, and possessed the ball to begin the fourth quarter. NFL teams simply don't squander 17-point leads in the fourth quarter, but the two-time defending NFC champion Seahawks did. Bengals won, 27-24, in overtime. The push might as well have been a loss. 
• @ Oakland + 5 1/2 over Denver. Raiders trailed, 9-7, midway through the fourth quarter and had first-and-10 at the Denver 36. Two plays later, on third-and-5, quarterback Derek Carr threw a pick-6 at precisely the time the Blue Angels did a flyover at O.co Coliseum. Broncos, despite zero offensive TDs, won, 16-10. 
Week 6 predictions: The lines, as will be the case all season, are from MGM Mirage via vegasinsider.com as of Wednesday afternoon unless noted (entertainment purposes only): 
Thursday night 
@ New Orleans + 3 1/2 over Atlanta 
Skinny: Every fiber of my being wanted to go with the Falcons in a walk. I really like the Falcons and QB Matt Ryan, and I don't think much of the Saints. But the Saints are at home and Drew Brees is their QB, which are enough to keep it within a field goal. Falcons, 24-21. 
Sunday 
@ Cleveland +4 over Denver 
Skinny: Browns QB Josh McCown is coming off a franchise-record 457 yards passing in an overtime victory at Baltimore. He has thrown for 300-plus in a franchise-best three straight games. But he is dealing with a gimpy left ankle, and the Broncos' defense is nasty. Gritty, gutty McCown manages to keep it close. Broncos, 23-21. 
@ Buffalo +3 1/2 over Cincinnati 
Skinny: Even if QB Tyrod Taylor were healthy, the Bills would be hard-pressed to beat the Bengals. Homefield and defense enable them to win ATS. Bengals, 19-16. 
Kansas City +3 1/2 over @ Minnesota 
Skinny: I freely admit to being in denial about the Chiefs; I refuse to believe they are as bad as their record. They fall to 1-5 but manage to make it interesting. Vikings, 26-23. 
@ Jacksonville + 1 over Houston 
Skinny: This pick is more about being disgusted with the 1-4 Texans than being bullish on the 1-4 Jaguars. Texans lead in fourth quarter, only to fold. Jaguars, 20-17. 
@ Detroit -3 over Chicago 
Skinny: In a strictly bull-headed move, I am sticking with the Lions until they win ATS. Lions, 17-13. 
@ New York Jets -6 over Washington 
Skinny: Jets are legit, and it is time for the Redskins to get blown out. Jets, 27-10. 
@ Pittsburgh +3 over Arizona 
Skinny: Cardinals should win easily, primarily because their defense can daze and confuse Steelers QB Michael Vick. This is one of those games when the NFL doesn't make sense. Steelers, 24-21. 
@ Tennessee -2 1/2 over Miami 
Skinny: Dolphins continue to disappoint. Titans QB Marcus Mariota excels. Titans, 23-13. 
@ Seattle -7 over Carolina 
Skinny: Panthers fall to 4-1 because they happened to be the Seahawks' opponent, in Seattle, after the meltdown in Cincinnati. Seattle's defense resumes being stingy. Seahawks, 20-9. 
@ Green Bay -10 over San Diego 
Skinny: I wanted to go with the Chargers because of I am getting double-digit points, but I am tired of doubting that the Packers (5-0) can cover large spreads. Packers, 33-21. 
@ San Francisco +2 1/2 over Baltimore 
Skinny: 49ers, insulted they are considered underdogs, pile more dirt on the Ravens' season. 49ers, 20-16. 
Sunday night 
New England -7 over @ Indianapolis 
Skinny: Just another regular-season game for the Patriots. Yeah, OK. Patriots and Brady close with flourish to improve to 5-0. Patriots, 38-23. 
Monday night 
@ Philadelphia -4 over New York Giants 
Skinny: Eagles sustain momentum from thumping of New Orleans in Week 5. Eagles, 28-17.
